column4: Is it possible to force a device/directory to stop being busy?
or force the deletion of a directory that is busy
lsof: WARNING: can't stat() fuseblk file system /media/[re]drive
see where its busy and kill the processes that are accessing it
you need to umount the mount oint first]
Ok I got it mounted as [re]drive
you should use gksudo, sudo is NOT for gui apps
I just used it to discover I can access my external HDD with root
then you may need to add it to /etc/fstab
I'm not sure what to add in the way of options
i don't think you should have the brackets in the line, i suggest you change the mount point
the brackets have worked for a while.. but how would I change the mount point
make a new empty folder with a simple name and then edit fstab to mirror the new folder
